newsitem.title: UK: Britain to ban landmine manufacture.
newsitem.headline: Britain to ban landmine manufacture.

text.p: Britain's new Labour government is to ban the import, export and manufacture of anti-personnel landmines, Prime Minister Tony Blair said on Wednesday.
He told Parliament an official government announcement of the ban will be made later in the day.

Officials said Britain would destroy all its stocks of anti-personnel landmines by 2005 and would scrap the idea of replacing them with so-called "smart mines' which destroy themselves after a set period.

This marks a significant change from the policy of the previous Conservative administration, which although dedicated to destroying existing stocks of landmines made clear it retained the option to buy smart mines.

The officials also said Britain intended to sign up to the so-called Ottawa Process, a Canadian initiative which groups 50 nations who want to sign a treaty by the end of this year to ban the production, stockpiling, export and use of mines.
Since taking power earlier this month, Labour has stressed the need for action on landmines, blamed for killing 25,000 people a year and maiming many more. Most of the victims are women and children.
